text: tis the season for pumpkin and I'm going
to be using it in a fantastic quick
bread today it's a pumpkin ginger low
and the best thing about this recipe it
makes two so you can share some with
friends and you can keep some for
yourself I have two and a half cups of
all-purpose flour here to that add two
teaspoons of baking powder two teaspoons
of ground ginger 1 teaspoon of coarse
salt if you're using fine be sure to use
half a teaspoon whisk whisk whisk set
aside your dry ingredients for a second
this bowl has 1 cup of brown sugar and
one cup of white sugar to that add 12
tablespoons of melted butter one and a
half sticks quick breads are great
because people love them they're easy to
throw together and they last for a while
so if you want to make these on a
weekend and share them with your
co-workers during the week you can
totally do that one can of pumpkin this
is pumpkin puree that you buy you could
certainly use your own if you wanted to
make fresh pumpkin puree you're a huge
fan of making your own just roast a
sugar pumpkin until it's tender and
puree it in the food processor add three
large eggs I think you can add them all
at once let's see what happens
and stir they'll get my whisk we've kept
very simple here with just the ginger
which is a classic combination with
pumpkin
you can add your dry ingredients to the
wet I'm going to add my wet to the dry
because my dry Bowl is bigger feel like
I'm going to go on a quick bread making
binge because it's so easy and they're
really versatile to eat them for
breakfast bring them to work for an
afternoon snack you can kind of do
anything with a batter like this stir
until it's fully smooth have your oven
preheating to 375 degrees these are two
eight and a half by four and a half inch
pans that have been buttered and floured
sometimes if I'm being really crazy and
I want to make sure it's completely even
I'll weigh them on my scale but I think
eyeballing it is probably fine that
looks good I think even them out in the
pans tap them just to make sure they're
nice and even and bake them until a cake
tester inserted in the center comes out
clean about fifty minutes let them cool
completely in their pans on a wire rack
you can put a glaze on this but I really
don't feel like it's necessary but if
you want to make a nice sugar glaze to
go on top it is kind of beautiful
especially if you're sharing with
friends but to keep it simple I think
it's just as beautiful all on its own
it's got a beautiful golden color mmm
smells gingery tastes like fall
you
